newsitem.title: USA: US manufacturers praise Fed for holding rates.
newsitem.headline: US manufacturers praise Fed for holding rates.

text.p: The National Association of Manufacturers praised the Federal Reserve's decision Tuesday to hold interest rates steady and suggested the central bank consider cutting rates later in 1996 if growth slows sharply.
"We now have stable inflation and real growth running below potential," Association President Jerry Jasinowski said in a statement. "The Federal Reserve should keep rates where they are.
"If the economy slows sharply later in the year, the Fed should consider cutting interest rates," he added.
